thread.title: Jose Mourinho hits back at Chelsea fans after jeers during Manchester United clash - 'Judas is No.1'
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho hits back at Chelsea fans after jeers during Manchester United clash - 'Judas is No.1'

author: John Cross
title: Jose Mourinho hits back at Chelsea fans after jeers during Manchester United clash - 'Judas is No.1'
text:
Thank you for subscribing!   
Jose Mourinho hit back at the Chelsea fans who turned on him after claiming: “Judas is No1.” 
Chelsea supporters jeered Mourinho during a bad tempered FA Cup quarter final which saw Ander Herrera sent off and his Manchester United team mate Marcos Rojo could face a ban for stamping on Eden Hazard. 
Mourinho was also involved in a touchline row with Chelsea boss Antonio Conte as Hazard was accused of diving to get Herrera sent off for a second yellow card. 
But Mourinho , who gestured with three fingers at the fans who abused him to show how many titles he won during his two spells in charge at Stamford Bridge, took an amazing blast at Chelsea. 
United boss Mourinho, whose side were beaten by N'Golo Kante's second half winner, said: “They can call me what they want. I am a professional. I defend my club. Mourinho gestures to the Chelsea fans (Photo: Matthew Peters/Man Utd via Getty Images) Jose Mourinho and Antonio Conte get fired up (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Antonio Conte and Jose Mourinho clash (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Michael Oliver speaks to the duo (Photo: PA) 
“Until the moment they have a manager that wins four Premier Leagues for them, I'm the No1. When they have somebody who wins four Premier Leagues for them, I'll be No2. For this moment, Judas is No1. 
“I left the club last season in the Champions League, winning the Champions League group, in the knockout phase playing the second leg at home. If they won the Champions League last year, they'd be playing in Europe this season. 
“It's not my fault. It's the ones that stayed here and didn't win the Champions League. What I share with them is that we didn't have a good Premier League, and I share responsibility with that.” Mourinho talks with referee Michael Oliver (Photo: REUTERS) Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho applauds supporters (Photo: AFP) 
Mourinho and Conte shook hands in the tunnel after the game but the United boss was clearly angry at referee Michael Oliver for sending off Herrera. 
“Compare Herrera's second yellow card with that of a couple of minutes later when Rashford goes to attack the space and the Chelsea captain grabs him, stops him in a counter-attack. Mr Oliver does not give a card, not even a yellow,” said Mourinho. 
United could also face an FA rap after their players surrounded Oliver following the red card while Rojo’s stamp could also result in a retrospective ban. 
But Conte angrily accused United of trying to ruin the game by kicking Hazard off the pitch. Chelsea's N'Golo Kante celebrates scoring (Photo: REUTERS) Chelsea manager Antonio Conte and N'Golo Kante (Photo: PA) Eden Hazard in action (Photo: PA) 
Conte added: “My point of view is this: they've got to play football, and my players want to play football. For 20 or 25 minutes, it was impossible for Hazard to play football. 
“I see only that he got a lot of kicks. But I don't think I'm crazy and I see only him in this situation. This is my reply to the question. 
"Hazard, for 25 minutes, it was impossible for him to play football. Only kicking. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
